meanings.definition: Full of or motivated by a desire for vengeance.
meanings.sent1: The revengeful villain plotted to make the hero pay for defeating him.
meanings.sent2: She felt revengeful after being betrayed by her closest friend.
meanings.sent3: The revengeful cat knocked over the vase as payback for being ignored.
meanings.sent4: His eyes held a revengeful glint as he confronted his enemy.
meanings.sent5: The revengeful storm unleashed its fury on the unsuspecting town.

meanings.definition: Inclined to seek retaliation or retribution.
meanings.sent1: The revengeful child refused to share his toys with his sister.
meanings.sent2: She had a revengeful nature and never forgave those who wronged her.
meanings.sent3: The revengeful squirrel stole all the nuts from the bird feeder just to annoy the birds.
meanings.sent4: His revengeful spirit drove him to seek justice for his family's honor.
meanings.sent5: The revengeful teacher gave extra homework to the students who talked during class.
